result.execSummary:
The defendant Katie M. Erickson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Katie M. Erickson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Katie M. Erickson was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Katie M. Erickson was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
*   Pay restitution in the sum of $159.92 plus surcharges.
May not have contact with Festival Food Stores in Kenosha, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Katie M. Erickson

records.addlTxt:
Restitution Determined by DA (not a court order) - $159.92
This total does not include 10% surcharge due Kenosha Co. Clerk of Courts.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Ct 1 & 3

02:36 PM
Defendant, Katie M. Erickson, appeared with Attorney Charles D Collier.
Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Cts 1 & 3:
Court orders withheld sentence; 
Defendant placed on concurrent probation for 12 months w/conditions;
No sentence credit given.
Court costs ordered; Restitution in the amount of $159 ordered to Festival Foods Store.
Submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.
Appeal rights given.

03:13 PM
Defendant, Katie M. Erickson, appeared with Attorney Charles D Collier.
Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Cts 1 & 3-Retail Theft-Intent. Take;
Found guilty by the court.  Cts 2 & 4 were dismissed outright on State's motion.
Def. atty request sentencing be set over so def. can complete her counseling.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Bond continued.

09:22 AM Defendant, Katie M. Erickson, appeared with Attorney Charles D Collier.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Matter resolved, def. atty asking for plea date.
Matter set over, bond cont'd.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:15 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:15 am.  $700  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  ts
